fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25826].
  {panel}

I have a script which is trying to edit the summary of a closed issue.

The error message I'm getting back is:

Error Messages: [You do not have permission to edit issues in this project.]: <SOAPpy.Types.structType detail at 74695672>: {'hostname': 'extranet-jira.private.atlassian.com', 'com.atlassian.jira.rpc.exception.RemoteException': ''}>

This is not strictly true; the user in question does have permission to edit issues in that project. I'm assuming that the actual error here is that closed issues can't be edited, and the error handling doesn't sufficiently disambiguate between being unable to edit because of permissions vs being unable to edit because the issue is closed.
fields.summary: Misleading error message when trying to edit a closed issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25823].
  {panel}

I was editing/configuring the system dashboard and accidentally browsed away while saving an edit.  When I returned all dashboards were blank.  Attempts to edit or copy any dashboard are all blank canvases.

firebug shows this error message: 
  uncaught exception: [Exception... ""  nsresult: "0x805e000a (<unknown>)"  location: "JS frame :: http://jira.firebare.org/jira/s/en_USdbfmbj/649/1/3.1.7/_/download/batch/com.atlassian.gadgets.dashboard:dashboard/com.atlassian.gadgets.dashboard:dashboard.js :: anonymous :: line 7"  data: no]

this problem does not appear with other browsers, or the same browser used from another account.  The problem persists over a variety of browser themes.  I flushed browser cache and cookies and the problem persists.  I see no errors in the server logs.  The integrity checker shows no anomalies.  I see no other problems with any other elements in any context.

There's some duff data stuck somewhere in the system.  Where/how can it be cleared?
fields.summary: dashboards blank after interrupted edit

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25818].
  {panel}

From a Support case:
{quote}
By the way, there is no documentation on atlassian's site to enable client authentication on Tomcat (JIRA). I had to use one of the many sites on the web that explain it (e.g., http://threebit.net/mail-archive/tomcat-users/msg06848.html, http://www.digicert.com/ssl-certificate-installation-tomcat.htm, etc.). The good thing is that JIRA's build already supported it. It just had to be configured manually. Here's what the specific portion of my server.xml looks like:

<Connector port="8443" protocol="org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11Protocol"
maxHttpHeaderSize="8192" SSLEnabled="true"
maxThreads="150" minSpareThreads="25" maxSpareThreads="75"
enableLookups="false" disableUploadTimeout="true"
acceptCount="100" scheme="https" secure="true"
clientAuth="true" sslProtocol="TLS" useBodyEncodingForURI="true" 
truststoreFile="C:\.keystore" />
{quote}

We need to update the [SSL documentation|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Running+JIRA+over+SSL+or+HTTPS] to include this for future references.
fields.summary: Update SSL documentation to include how to enable client auth on Tomcat

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25791].
  {panel}

I'm trying to connect JIRA 4.4.1 to a Sql Server 2008 database using Windows Authentication (it's a violation of my company's security policy to store passwords in files, so I must try to avoid using Sql accounts).

I attached the error I'm seeing. Although jTDS supports windows authentication, I think your parser is requiring the username and password to be specified.

I've attached my dbconfig.xml. Note that there is no username or password element. I've also tried just leaving the username and password element blank and got the same error.

Please add support for Windows Authentication and Sql Server.
fields.summary: Windows Authentication doesn't work on Sql Server

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25767].
  {panel}

Scenario:
1. Work is logged and a 'logged work' entry appears in the 'Activity' list e.g. 1 hour. There is no 'Worklog Id' displayed.
2. Subsequently the time logged on this activity is changed from 1 hour to 2 hours
3. The 'Activity' list now shows two entries. One for 1 hour (original entry) and a new one 'made changes' which shows the original time, the new time and a 'Worklog Id'.

Problem:
Without going to another screen, there is no way to relate the change (='made changes') of 1 hour to the earlier original (='logged work') entry of 1 hour. Only the original entry includes the text describing what action was taken.

Solution:
Inlcude the 'Worklog Id' in every entry on the Activity list. This is only a few characters but allows the viewer to easily follow the trail of changes back through the Activity list.
fields.summary: There is no worklog id included in the "logged work" entry under "activity"
Inconsistant field identifier for "Issue Type"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25764].
  {panel}

Is there a reason JIRA does not utilize or document the use of the "-server" JVM input arguement? To get a better understanding of how this parameter is useful, please see the following excerpt from http://download.oracle.com/javase/6/docs/technotes/guides/vm/index.html :

{quote}
On all platforms, the JDK comes with an implementation of the Java virtual machine called the Java HotSpot Server VM (server VM). The server VM is designed for maximum program execution speed. It can be invoked by using the -server command-line option when launching an application.

Excerpt from
The Java HotSpot Performance Engine Architecture
http://java.sun.com/products/hotspot/whitepaper.html

The JDK includes two flavors of the VM - a client-side offering, and a VM tuned for server applications. These two solutions share the Java HotSpot runtime environment code base, but use different compilers that are suited to the distinctly unique performance characteristics of clients and servers. These differences include the compilation inlining policy and heap defaults.

The JDK contains both of the these systems in the distribution, so developers can choose which system they want by specifying -client or -server.

Although the Server and the Client VMs are similar, the Server VM has been specially tuned to maximize peak operating speed. It is intended for executing long-running server applications, which need the fastest possible operating speed more than a fast start-up time or smaller runtime memory footprint.

The Client VM compiler serves as an upgrade for both the Classic VM and the just-in-time (JIT) compilers used by previous versions of the JDK. The Client VM offers improved run time performance for applications and applets. The Java HotSpot Client VM has been specially tuned to reduce application start-up time and memory footprint, making it particularly well suited for client environments. In general, the client system is better for GUIs.

The Client VM compiler does not try to execute many of the more complex optimizations performed by the compiler in the Server VM, but in exchange, it requires less time to analyze and compile a piece of code. This means the Client VM can start up faster and requires a smaller memory footprint.

The Server VM contains an advanced adaptive compiler that supports many of the same types of optimizations performed by optimizing C++ compilers, as well as some optimizations that cannot be done by traditional compilers, such as aggressive inlining across virtual method invocations. This is a competitive and performance advantage over static compilers. Adaptive optimization technology is very flexible in its approach, and typically outperforms even advanced static analysis and compilation techniques.
{quote}
fields.summary: Do we utilize the "-server" JVM option?

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25763].
  {panel}

It would be great if we can have another look into the modules used for processing the patterns for project keys.

The [documentation|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+Project+Keys] currently states that we should avoid using *"." and "-"*, but any one who is familiar with regular expressions expects to use them with minimal exception to the defining standard. 

A recent support case arose when a customer used:

* jira.projectkey.pattern = ([A-Z]([-_.]?[A-Z0-9])*)

The workaround was:
{quote}
To "fix" the problem on my desktop, I had to use a very specific set of conditions:

# The pattern had to be encapsulated in a simple capture group (i.e. bounded with "(" and ")").
# All interior groups (parenthetic groups) had to be non-capturing (i.e. bounded with "(?:" and ")". As follows in my case:
** jira.projectkey.pattern = ([A-Z](?:[-_.]?[A-Z0-9])*)

That said, the fix is a work-around, not a true fix.

As you are aware, the pattern is processed using the

* java.util.regex.Pattern

and

* java.util.regex.Matcher

classes. The full specification of the pattern language can be found in the JavaDoc:
* http://download.oracle.com/javase/6/docs/api/java/util/regex/Pattern.html
{quote}
fields.summary: Improve on the Project Key modules
Wider and more friendly "Issue Search" screen

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25744].
  {panel}

Certain jpg files cause an exception to be raised which affects the rendering of the Attachment section while viewing an issue. Most jpgs do not cause this exception. Affected images do display in the "Attach Files" dialog during file attachment. Ideally JIRA could catch the exception and display a placeholder image as well as rendering the other attachments.

The root cause of the issue seems to be the java image processor, possibly during the creation of a thumbnail. The issue was present in java 5 but was masked. When we upgraded to JIRA 4.4 we also upgraded Java and this issue is now more visible due to bug fixes in Java. (http://bugs.sun.com/bugdatabase/view_bug.do?bug_id=6791502)

The exception is "javax.imageio.IIOException: Invalid icc profile: bad sequence number" - I can provide the entire trace if that would help.

The only images I have contain protected information. I am working to have a generic image created which I will attach to this issue. The attached screenshot is an issue with 3 attachments but none show. If I delete the offending JPG the remain two attachments are displayed properly.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create an issue with attachments
2. Attach a JPG that causes the javax.imageio.IIOException exception (I will provide)
3. View the issue - some or all attachments will not be displayed
4. Click "Manage Attachments" and delete the offending JPG
5. View the issue - attachments will be displayed properly
fields.summary: Attaching certain JPGs causes Attachments section of issue view to not render
Update MySQL Documentation
Improve indexing performance for those entities that are retrieved from the NodeAssociation table
Updating user directories not to completely hide it from the user logged in

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25738].
  {panel}

*Steps to reproduce:*

# Go to the view issue page.
# Scroll down the page.
# Open a dropdown in the navbar, e.g. issues.
# Highlight the first item.

*Result:* The page is automatically scrolled upwards, even though the highlighted item was already fully in view. This does not occur on pages other than view issue, and is due to the presence of the stalker. {{jQuery.fn.scrollIntoView}} (scrollIntoView.js) is miscalculating the element's position when trying to account for the stalker.
fields.summary: Window scrolls unnecessarily when highlighting dropdown list item

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25731].
  {panel}

When the Linux installer is used, the jre shipped with JIRA is embedded in the bin/permgen.sh script, and that script then exports JAVA_HOME.

It would be good to document how to change the JAVA_HOME with JIRA 4.4, since all the ways it is documented for 4.3 and earlier may not work due to this script.
E.g. adding JAVA_HOME to the top of bin/setenv.sh didn't have any effect because of permgen.sh already doing an export.

One use case for this is when an admin has add certificates to a particular JVM's keystore and wishes to use that JVM and not the one shipped with the JIRA installer.
fields.summary: How to change JAVA_HOME with JIRA 4.4

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25729].
  {panel}

This bug report comes from a jira studio customer (https://jirastudio.kodak.com) which provided all the steps to reproduce in the support ticket as described below. 



Hi.
We ran across a odd ball error when one of our project administrators was trying to edit role members. This bug has been in the last couple of versions.

To Reproduce:
1) Create a project with all defaults. Make a copy of the Default permissions scheme and modify the permissions so that there are two roles in the Administer Projects permission (Using Administrators and EK_SQL_Low_Email, File: permprob1.jpg)
2) Assign the new permission scheme to the project.
3) Create two users "testuser1" and "testuser2", assign testuser1 to the Administrator, Developer and User roles and assign testuser2 to the EK_SQL_Low_Email, Developer and User roles. Neither of these users should be global administrators (i.e. not in the "administrators" group).
4) Login as testuser1, go to the people page and try to remove testuser2 from the EK_SQL_Low_Email role. You'll get a message "You can not remove a user/group that will result in completely removing yourself from this role." (File: permprob2.jpg)
5) As a workaround, if user testuser1 adds themself to the EK_SQL_Low_Email role, then they can remove testuser2 without error.

Thanks.
fields.summary: Error when a project admin is trying to remove a user from a role.

fields.description:
The default Rapid Board query includes "fixVersion in unreleasedVersions()" to show any upcoming issues, but this includes issues assigned to archived versions that will never be released.

I would expect unreleasedVersions() only to include versions that will be released.
fields.summary: unreleasedVersions() shouldn't include archived versions
Role-based workflow

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25718].
  {panel}

Customers jira site is treated as local intranet site in our office environment, this cause IE9 and IE8 all use "IE7 standards" mode ( another colleague reported another bug when viewing a dropdown selection list on IE8, which is also caused by IE8 using IE7 standards more).

See:
http://sharovatov.wordpress.com/2009/05/18/ie8-rendering-modes-theory-and-practice/

"If there's no X-UA-Compatible value and site is in Local Intranet security zone, it will be rendered in EmulateIE7 mode by default."

The current workaround ( press F12, change it to IE9 standard for IE9 browser or IE8 standards for IE8 browser) only work for current IE instance, if I close all IE window and restart it again, I have to reset the browser mode for jira site again.

I think a new feature can be added to jira like:

if it found the client browser is IE8, send back header X-UA-Compatible to IE8;
if it found the client browser is IE9, send back header X-UA-Compatible to IE9.

IE7 mode in JIRA 4.4 has unpredictable behaviour as seen in the screenshot.
fields.summary: IE7 standards mode in IE8 and IE9 not to enable in JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25707].
  {panel}

The sub-task should inherit the parent component/version even after parent issue has been moved to other project.   

Steps to reproduce:
# Create a issue in a Project A and assign a Fix Version of "Sprint 1".
# Create sub-task under this issue, fix version will automatically will be assigned to this sub-task i.e "Sprint 1".
# Move the issue to a another project say Project B.
# While moving the issue it will ask for the FixVersion for this issue of Project B.
# Select FixVersion "Sprint 1" in Project B(if fixversion is not there please create a fix version "Sprint 1" in Project B ).
# Afer moving the issue go to Project B and open the movied issue.
# Open its sub-task.
# The sub-task FixVersion is 'unassigned' now, in principle when the issue's fix version is moved its sub-task fix version must also be moved to new project.
fields.summary: When moving an issue with sub-tasks, the sub-tasks should inherit the parent component/version automatically
Role-based menu access

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25705].
  {panel}

Images are only shown if users are accessing their email using a client (e.g. their web browser) that shares the same session that they have used to log into JIRA. In the case that they are not, no image is shown.

Steps to reproduce:
# Go to {{user1}}'s User Profile and choose a 'Custom Image' through the Avatar picker.
# Perform an activity that notifies {{user2}} via email (e.g. @mention).
# Ensure that you are not logged into JIRA and check {{user2}}'s email inbox.
# BUG: Custom image picked by {{user1}} is not shown in email notifications.

*Special note:* This has reoccured in later versions of JIRA and is being worked on in [JRA-41675|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-41675].
fields.summary: Images are not shown in email notifications
No python code formatter in JIRA
Logged time in subtasks should automatically substract its parent time estimate

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25700].
  {panel}

I have spent a couple of hours converting many of my workflow transitions to common transitions and then reordered them in XML only to discover that the common workflow transitions ALWAYS appear below the regular workflow items despite the order in the XML. Very frustrating.

I can not use the opsbar-sequence solution provided in JRA-5789 because the common workflow items are not in the same order for every transition (it would work nicely if that was what I was looking for - although still a pain to implement). 
For the record the opsbar-sequence is stored in the common action XML data for common transitions.

JIRA really needs a better method of implementing this order before the use of common transitions becomes more popular.
fields.summary: The order of common workflow transitions and regular workflow transitions can not be intermingled by editing XML

fields.description:
Cryptic error message after importing components.

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Importing+Data+from+Bugzilla doesn't bear a lot of similarity to the actual import process... eg. there is no Maximum issues and failues option anywhere along the line.

Log file contains the following stack trace:


2011-09-14 11:45:22,632 ERROR - Unexpected failure occurred. Importer will stop immediately. Data maybe in an unstable state
java.util.UnknownFormatConversionException: Conversion = ' '
	at java.util.Formatter.checkText(Formatter.java:2503)
	at java.util.Formatter.parse(Formatter.java:2485)
	at java.util.Formatter.format(Formatter.java:2414)
	at java.util.Formatter.format(Formatter.java:2367)
	at java.lang.String.format(String.java:2769)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.imports.importer.impl.FileImportLogger.log(FileImportLogger.java:44)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25678].
  {panel}

It appears the z-index on the JIRA Header is exposing the following issue with Safari on Mac OS X.
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/5305680/mac-safari-5-0-4-bug-when-using-google-maps-api/5486463#5486463

Whenever the Google Map is displayed, the header just disappears. See screenshot, or view this live issue http://connect.onjira.com/browse/NERDS-412 (Click on the location field)

This does not happen in Studio, or in JIRA 4.3.
fields.summary: JIRA Header disappears when a Google Map is rendered in JIRA

fields.description:
JQL Component picker shows the first matching components out of the full list of components.  Witha large number of projects with custom component sets the list is enormous.  To make it worse, component names may be vary across projects, so you need to guess the component name then guess whether the hit you get is actually the one in the project.

Better: picker uses the project(s) in the query to filter the displayed component list.
fields.summary: JQL component picker should show relevant components
Mail config page should not forget the password
Need to have a way to set the maximumum JDBC timeout for DBCP

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25672].
  {panel}

# create a filter
# share will a project but do not hit the "blue plus - Add" button.  
# hit the save button
# filter is saved

When you go through the same actions when creating a dashboard you get a warning that the your attempt to filter the dashboard is not complete.  this is a nice touch we should add to shared filters.
fields.summary: User does not get a warning that their attempt to share a filter is incomplete - you do get a warning when sharing a dashboard

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25667].
  {panel}

I would like to request that Jira incorporate an option to use the diff Unified Output Format for all text field changes. As is now, the full text is displayed twice and users must manually determine the differences. This works for small bodies of text but is very problematic for large bodies. This can greatly reduce the size of notifications and history.

We currently see:

{code}Ryan Steed updated TICKET-1234:
---------------------------

    Description: 
Test ticket. Testing...
1
2
3




  was:
Test ticket.
{code}

But would like to see something like:

{code}Ryan Steed updated TICKET-1234:
---------------------------

    Description: 
--- 2011-09-12 15:23:29.000000000 -0600
+++ 2011-09-12 15:23:14.000000000 -0600
@@ -1 +1,4 @@
-Test ticket.
+Test ticket. Testing...
+1
+2
+3
{code}
fields.summary: Implement optional diff Unified Output Format for Change History and Ticket Update Email Notifications

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25666].
  {panel}

Currently User without any Project Roles can't be associated to any Project Role as describe in the steps below:
# Create one user
# remove the user from all Project Roles 
# Administration >> Users >> select user >> click on the +Project Roles+ > Click on +Edit Project Roles+ > will not have the ability to associate user to any Project Role
fields.summary: Should be able to associate Project Roles to User with empty Project Roles
Improved reporting plugin with real printable reports
JIRA Should Trim The Group Name Retrieved From Crowd

fields.summary: Unable to render {include} The included page could not be found on Greenhopper license documentation
Order of Non-custom Field in The 'View Issue' page is Ignored by default, It should be handler more gracefully
Add Information That Certificate Might Need To Be Imported To JIRA's JRE for JIRA 4.4
Option to create JIRA installation directory as a non-root user
Create/Edit Issue Page needs CREATE/UPDATE button at the TOP.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25653].
  {panel}

From a project management perspective the way our team works is that we estimate at the Story level and then have the developers creates sub-tasks and log their work at the sub-task level.  The issue we have is that the time logged against the sub-task does not reduce the remaining estimate we did at the Story level.  This allows us to do a top-down style of estimation. If there could be an option to allow you to select where you want your time rolled up to, or have a preference on how time tracking works, it would be appreciated.

Example:
* Story is estimated at 16 hours
* Several sub-tasks are created with no estimations
* 4 hours worth of work is done against a sub-task
* Remaining time left on Story to be 12 hours
fields.summary: Estimate at Parent Story, Log work at Sub-task
Logging work for a few days in a row.
Add bulk remove function that will allow removing a role/group/person from a permission scheme
Change attachment links in Jira to be _target="blank", or make it a configurable option.
Export a Filter's column configuration to other Filters

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-25640].
{panel}
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 11 September 2019|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9|titleBGColor=#ebf2f9|bgColor=#ffffff}
This has now been implemented as the [{{issueLinkType}}|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracorecloud/advanced-searching-fields-reference-765593716.html#Advancedsearching-fieldsreference-issuelinktypeIssuelinktype] field, with the same behaviour as the equivalent, [recently-added Jira Server functionality|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftware/jira-software-8-0-x-release-notes-957981626.html#JiraSoftware8.0.xreleasenotes-Findlinktypes(issueLinkType)].

Additionally, we've also added an [{{issueLink}}|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracorecloud/advanced-searching-fields-reference-765593716.html#Advancedsearching-fieldsreference-issuelinkIssuelink] field, which functions equivalently to the {{linkedIssue()}} JQL function, but is more discoverable and flexible.
{panel}
originally copied from this comment
{quote}Function linkedIssues() only shows the issues linked to a particular issue, I want to find all issues those are linked to other issues marked by a specific link type, e.g., "is blocked by".
{quote}
This function could incorporate querying issues that are linked _to any issue_ with a given link type and bearing in mind that links have two identities, one in each direction, the link type could be direction specific or not.
h4. Examples
 # find all issues that are duplicates of issue JRA-25640 (one direction, issue specified)
 # find all issues that are blocking issue JRA-25640 or that JRA-25640 blocks (bidirectional, issue specified)
 # find all issues that are duplicates of any issue, or which duplicate any issue (bidirectional, no issue specified)
 # find all issues that are blocked (one direction, no issue specified)
 # find all issues that are linked to a specific issue and display those based on a specific depth (linked issues displaying linked relationship two, three, etc., issues deep)

h4. Implementation Notes
 * The JQL function that exists must continue to work exactly as it does. If it is possible to overload the JQL function based on arity and this makes a consistent API, then this would be preferred. Otherwise, there may need to be a new function name which provides vararg behaviour as described above.
 * The link index entries added in 4.4 (I think) provide enough to build performant lucene queries for the above use cases. What's missing is the JQL function plumbing.
fields.summary: JQL function for showing all issues linked to any issue by a given issue link type
When autocomplete is disabled for component creation, putting in an invalid value makes it invalid until page refresh
